summary: An email from an Assistant United States Attorney to an attorney named Jack, forwarding a court order from Judge Alison Nathan regarding compliance with SDNY Local Rule 23.1 in the expanded United States v. Maxwell case. The order applies to all attorneys representing parties and witnesses.

persons.name: Jack
persons.context: The recipient of an email from an Assistant U.S. Attorney regarding a court order in the United States v. Maxwell case.

persons.name: Judge Nathan
persons.context: Issued the court order regarding compliance with SDNY Local Rule 23.1 that is being forwarded in the email.

persons.name: Assistant United States Attorney
persons.context: The sender of the email, forwarding Judge Nathan's order and reminding the recipient of compliance with local court rules.

connections.description: The prosecutor is communicating a court order and legal reminder to the attorney, Jack.
Judge Nathan's order applies to Jack and other attorneys in the case.

events.title: Judge Nathan Issues Order on Local Rule 23.1
events.description: Judge Alison Nathan issued an order reminding counsel for parties and witnesses to comply with SDNY Local Rule 23.1.

events.title: Prosecutor Forwards Court Order
events.description: An Assistant U.S. Attorney emails attorney Jack to forward Judge Nathan's order, noting it now applies due to an expanded indictment.

keyFacts: The indictment in United States v. Maxwell, 20 Cr. 330 (AJN) has been expanded.
A previous order from Judge Alison Nathan regarding compliance with SDNY Local Rule 23.1 now applies to all attorneys representing parties and witnesses in the case.
The communication is a procedural reminder from a prosecutor to a defense attorney about court rules.
The email originates from 1 St. Andrew's Plaza, the address for the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York.
